title: Robot sensor EDA, FE and Prediction Improvement
description: Introduction:Robots are smart… by design. To fully understand and properly navigate a task, however, they need input about their environment. In this competition, you’ll help robots recognize the floor surface they’re standing on using data collected from Inertial Measurement Units (IMU sensors). About Data:CareerCon has collected IMU sensor data while driving a small mobile robot over different floor surfaces on the university premises. Objective:The task is to predict which one of the nine floor types (carpet, tiles, concrete) the robot is on using sensor data such as acceleration and velocity. Succeed and you'll help improve the navigation of robots without assistance across many different surfaces, so they won’t fall down on the job.
